title: Places & Forts of Jaipur: Must-Visit Attractions

places.generalDescription: Cradled on the top of the Aravali Hill and forming a beautiful reflection across the Maotha Lake, lies the Amber Fort. An architectural masterpiece and with significant reference in Indian history, it is visited by over five thousand tourists daily.
places.name: Amber Palace

reviews.text:
Amber Fort is one of those places that leaves you awestruck the moment you see it........Huge, majestic, and full of history, it easily takes 2‚Äì3 hours to explore........though you‚Äôll hardly notice the time passing. The Sheesh Mahal is simply magical........the tiny mirrors sparkle beautifully, even in the faintest light.
I‚Äôd highly recommend taking a local guide........they share fascinating stories, little-known facts, and bring the fort‚Äôs past to life in a way that signboards never can. The architecture is stunning........with a perfect blend of Rajput charm and Mughal elegance, and the views of Maota Lake from the top are picture-perfect.
If you can........arrive early to enjoy the elephant ride up to the fort........it‚Äôs a unique, royal touch to the experience. For a different vibe........there‚Äôs also a light and sound show in the evening that tells the fort‚Äôs history beautifully.
Amber Fort isn‚Äôt just a sightseeing spot........it‚Äôs a walk through Rajasthan‚Äôs glorious past........and honestly........it‚Äôs one of Jaipur‚Äôs must-visits.

Amber Fort is a must-visit when in Jaipur  the architecture, history, and views are truly mesmerizing. Exploring the fort takes about 1‚Äì2 hours including photo sessions.

To avoid the rush, reach by 10‚Äì11 am ‚Äî on weekends, parking queues can stretch up to an hour. If you‚Äôre in a cab with a guide, they‚Äôll usually take you through the village shortcut and park at the top, saving you a lot of time. Walking through the fort makes you appreciate how such massive structures were built centuries ago without modern machinery.

Opted to hike to the top of the fort instead of taking a jeep, allowing for a deeper exploration of every corner of this magnificent site. The breathtaking view of the mountains opposite the fort was truly unforgettable. A marvelous and grand architectural structure.

Visiting Amber Fort was truly a memorable experience! I highly recommend going early in the morning ‚Äì the temperature is pleasant, and the crowd is minimal, making it perfect to explore the fort peacefully and click great photos without much disturbance.

A small tip: do not book a jeep to reach the fort entrance. It‚Äôs completely unnecessary. The walk uphill is hardly 200-300 meters and very manageable, even in casual footwear.

Hiring a guide is a must if you want to understand the rich history and architectural details of the fort. The official guide charges are ‚Çπ400 for a group of 1-4 people and ‚Çπ600 for a group of 6-14. It‚Äôs definitely worth it for the added insight.

One important caution: avoid buying souvenirs from the shops inside the fort. They are extremely overpriced ‚Äì you can find the same items outside the fort or in the local markets for 4-5 times cheaper.

Overall, Amber Fort is stunning and offers a great start to your Jaipur trip if you plan wisely!

This palace is a great example of Rajput architecture. You can easily access this place by road and there is lots of parking available. As it is on a hilly area so you have to climb the stairs and walk a little to reach the fort. Once you are inside the fort you are mesmerized by its beauty and the wonderful designs. There is a lake also which adds extra layer to the beauty of this palace. Must visit place whenever you are in Jaipur.

places.description: Structure known as both Amer and Amber, with Hindu & Muslim elements & offering elephant rides.

places.generalDescription: Embellished with delicate carvings and stonework, the Nahargarh Fort is an impregnable structure, that together with its two neighbouring forts - Amer and Jaigarh, once stood as the strong defence of Jaipur city.
places.name: Nahargarh Fort

reviews.text: A must visit place in Jaipur. You can drive your car up to the top of the hill to reach this fort. Road in good but in the end very narrow. Parking is available near fort. From roof top of this fort, you get best view of entire Jaipur city. Amazing place.

Nahargarh Fort is one of the best places to visit in Jaipur especially if you enjoy nature and views. The fort is easily reachable by bike with a smooth road and a short ride through scenic hills. The views from the top are just stunning especially during sunset when you can see the whole city of Jaipur. The fort itself has beautiful old architecture and a peaceful vibe. There are a few cafes inside to relax and enjoy snacks. The area is clean and well maintained
Sunset at Nahargarh Fort is divine. The view overlooking the town and hills is profound. Beware of monkeys is REAL here! The rooftop is unlike any other rooftop, royal luxury. We had a great visit.

The experience in the fort is very good but its subject to the weather you're going in. We visited during rainy day and it was quite good (we had umbrellas with us) the view of the city from top of the fort is breathtaking. We miss some local food items near or within the fort. If they were there then it will be an add up to overall experience.

Visited Nahargarh Fort recently and it‚Äôs truly a must-visit! The day view is breathtaking, but the night view with sparkling city lights is simply unforgettable.
The place does get hot during the day, so the best time to visit is from mid-August to February.

A small tip: you‚Äôll find monkeys around in the evening. Avoid carrying water bottles in your hand or teasing them ‚Äì I had one snatch mine! Bring some extra water for them instead.

Overall, an amazing spot for photography and one of the best city views I‚Äôve ever seen. Highly recommend!

places.description: Elaborate fort built in 1734 in the hills above Jaipur, offering sweeping views of the city.
places.address: Krishna Nagar, Brahampuri, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001, India

places.generalDescription: Originally a residence of Rajadhiraj Hari Singh of the Achrol family in the 1930s, Hari Mahal Palace has now been partly converted into a heritage luxury hotel.
places.name: Hari Mahal Palace by Pachar Group

reviews.text: Awesome accommodation, food, service and indoor swimming pool and sauna. Staff people courteous and give respect to guests. KP singh nice guy. Jyoti mam took feedback and we loved it. Overall excellent experience. Will come again.

It was a very good stay at Hari Mahal villas. Totally heritage property very close to the Civil lines. The garden the restaurant and swimming pool were excellent  I have to specially mention the service Mr.Yashwant was a great host, very courteous, friendly and dynamic. From checkin to checkout he took good care of us and also briefed about other hotels of yours. I am waiting to visit your Pushkar resort. The breakfast and dinner menu was good.  Overall a pleasant stay.

The central location of this Heritage hotel makes it very convenient to reach. Less than a km from residence of the Chief Minister of Rajasthan. Well spread lawns are ideal for parties, and other functions.

While our last week visit to the hotel we were promised that the pool is in working condition which our kids were looking forward for it but I wasn't working and clean at all even after we made them aware of this issue.
We stayed in one of there's accommodation which had three rooms needed for whole family to stay together. I know it's heritage hotel but there furniture is outdated it's not antique at all atleast in our apartment we stayed.
We were told it has kitchen but it wasn't there not even fridge it was provided after we made them aware of issue.
Washrooms were not clean specifically taps and shower heads some taps were not working. One washroom had no door lock to lock while someone is using it.
Carpet was filthy and very dirty TV was from 1990s.
They need to do lot of work in that accommodation compare how much they are charging for it.
Overall it wasn't a great experience most of the staff was helpful and did best to their abilities. Will not recommend friends and family.
We stayed in Hari Mahal Palace for the second time. Staff is cordial. Property is heritage and old but very neat and clean. Worth for the money

places.description: Colourful suites in a laid-back 1930s residence-turned-hotel offering a restaurant & an indoor pool.
places.address: Tirthraj, Jacob Road, Civil Lines, Madrampur, Civil Lines, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302006, India

places.generalDescription: Built-in 1729, Rajmahal Palace is a symbol of love by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II for his wife. Briefly occupied by the British, this palace in Jaipur has now been restored and converted into a luxury stay.
places.name: Rajmahal Palace RAAS Jaipur

reviews.text:
Amazing Hotel in a palatial building that is way different to the usual 5 star luxury hotel chains you‚Äôd usually experience.

Gorgeous building probably few hundred years old. Beautifully maintained. Unmatched service! Restaurant staff in particular are some of the best we‚Äôve experienced.

One of the most breathtaking places I‚Äôve ever visited!

I recently visited Rajmahal Palace in Jaipur, and honestly ‚Äî I‚Äôm speechless! The beauty of this place is just unreal. Lush greenery everywhere, aesthetic vibes all around, and the sound of peacocks in the background made it feel like a scene from a royal dream. The palace itself gives proper mahal wali vibe ‚Äî perfect for a peaceful date, a shoot, or just to soak in the grandeur.

Every corner is photogenic ‚Äî literally Instagram heaven. I couldn‚Äôt get enough of it. The caf√© and restaurant inside are also top-notch ‚Äî both in service and taste.

I didn‚Äôt stay this time, but next time I‚Äôm definitely booking a stay here to experience the royal hospitality to the fullest.
Highly recommend this gem in Jaipur!

The cultural experience at Raj mahal Palace RAAS Jaipur left us with many stories and great memories. The hotel facilities and room services are exceptional. The staff are also accommodating and friendly.

Terrible Experience - Not Safe, Avoid at All Costs!

My wife and I booked this hotel for our stay in Jaipur, India, expecting a safe and comfortable place to rest during our travels from the USA. Unfortunately, our experience turned out to be nothing short of a nightmare.

Around 11 PM on the night 1, while we were in our room sleeping, the ceiling suddenly collapsed on us. The room's fan was bent, and as debris fell, my wife was injured with some scratches and a small injury to her head. Thankfully, we weren‚Äôt more seriously hurt, but this incident left us shaken and traumatized. The hotel did offer us a refund and free meals, but after such a terrifying experience, we couldn‚Äôt trust the safety of the place anymore.

We chose this hotel based on its appearance and amenities, but after the ceiling collapse, it was clear that the building was poorly maintained. It didn‚Äôt seem safe, and the lack of guests staying there only added to our concerns. We immediately cut our trip short after the incident and decided to stay at another hotel.

I would strongly advise anyone considering this hotel to look elsewhere. It was a terrifying experience that left us with lasting trauma, and it‚Äôs not worth the risk to your safety.

Very beautiful, elegant and nice place . We went for drinks and lunch. Both time had a great time .good food , good ambiance and very good services. The place is so nice with a very pleasant feeling that you do t want to leave. The bar, the barman is sooo nice and great cocktails proposition. A place that I would definitively go back next time in Jaipur

places.description: Genteel luxury hotel in a royal palace with formal gardens, plus dining, a spa & an outdoor pool.
places.address: Sardar Patel Marg, Shivaji Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001, India

places.generalDescription: At a distance of around 56 kms from Jaipur, Samode Palace is a heritage palace cum hotel. A fusion of Muslim and Rajputana architecture, this palace in Jaipur also houses Sheesh Mahal or Hall of Mirrors.
places.name: Samode Palace

reviews.text: I recently visited Samode Palace with my family, and it was an amazing experience. The palace is stunning, with its beautiful heritage architecture and intricate artwork. The staff was very polite and cooperative, which made our stay even more pleasant. Surrounded by lush greenery, the palace offers breathtaking views and a truly serene environment. We had a wonderful time there!

A Slice of Royalty ‚Äì Truly Phenomenal! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Samode Palace is pure magic. From the moment we arrived, it felt like we were stepping into a fairytale. The architecture, the heritage, the peaceful atmosphere‚Äîit all came together to create an experience I‚Äôll never forget.

The hospitality was beyond amazing. Every member of the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and cared for. The food was delicious, the rooms were stunning and full of character, and every little detail‚Äîfrom the courtyards to the candle-lit dinners‚Äîfelt thoughtful and special.

I genuinely didn‚Äôt want to leave. This place has a certain charm that stays with you. I‚Äôd go back in a heartbeat.

Highly recommend it if you‚Äôre looking to soak in history, luxury, and warmth all in one unforgettable getaway.

The architecture is simply stunning, showcasing a rich history and exquisite craftsmanship. The staff was incredibly attentive and provided exceptional service throughout my stay. The rooms were comfortable, well-appointed, and offered a serene atmosphere. The best time to visit is either in the winter or monsoon; avoid the summer.

Visited Samode Palace for a day trip and breakfast. The architecture is absolutely stunning, and the views are breathtaking. The staff was attentive and courteous, contributing to an overall pleasant experience. However, the breakfast was quite disappointing, especially considering the price of ‚Çπ1500 per person. The options were very basic, and many items lacked flavor. It was evident that some dishes were cooked in reused oil, giving off an unpleasant smell. The breads were hard, and the juices were bland. Unfortunately, the quality of the breakfast did not match the otherwise excellent ambiance and service.

Great place for a royal stay. They upgraded our suite once we arrived, what a pleasant surprise! The staff is world class, service prompt and the best part was the food. Our compliments for the chef! We felt we were in good hands all the time! Would love to visit again when we find some time.

places.description: Elegant hotel offering upscale dining, a spa & a rooftop pool, plus free breakfast & parking.
places.address: Village Samode, Tehsil, Chomu, Samod, Rajasthan 303806, India

places.generalDescription: Bhangarh Fort, built in 1613, is considered one of the most haunted places in India. It features natural springs, waterfalls, and temples, and is located about 75 km from Jaipur.
places.name: Bhangarh Fort

reviews.text:
A historical fort with horror twist. Beautiful landscape with lots of greenery. 2-3 temples also there. But too crowded with local people so no haunted feeling at all.
I did not get any facility here. The ticket here was for 25 rupees. After buying the ticket, when we went inside, we found dirt everywhere. And there were many monkeys inside the fort.

It was good to visit over there and diving into the history of Bhangarh fort. While going to the top there was a small area which was stinging too much due to the presence of bats. Good to go during October - April. Nature beauty is there and pics also come ausmn. If it is raining then do go in rubber slippers because you will confront the water coming from the nearby water falls.

A mysterious fort which is famous for its beautiful architecture but much more famous as Bhoot Bengla.
Very good location sorrouded alongwith Aravali hills..a levish green üíö
Lots of visitors come here in search of its mysterious facts, which are clearly written here on the board. No one allowed here after Sunset.
General facilities available.
Lack of cleanliness.. staff don't Care.

A good place for nature and history lovers as well as a well family can we planned. Also famous as most haunted place in India. Nearby location is full of natural beauty and wildlife as it falls under Sariska  .

fascinating mix of eerie legends and beautiful ruins. Set against the Aravalli hills, it‚Äôs quiet, atmospheric, and great for exploring. The ghost stories add to the thrill, but the real charm lies in its ancient architecture and mysterious vibe. No facilities nearby, so go prepared. Worth a visit for anyone into history or offbeat places.

places.description: Landmark historic fort complex featuring ruins of Hindu temples, royal palaces & tombs.

places.generalDescription: Built by Thakur of Kanota, General Amar Singh, Narain Niwas Palace boasts of Anglo Indian style of architecture of the Victorian era. This is one of the palaces in Jaipur which has now been converted into a heritage home.
places.name: Hotel Narain Niwas Palace

reviews.text: We had an absolutely amazing stay at this hotel. The room was authentic, cozy, and full of character. The bathroom was a bit old, as expected in an old palace, but it was very clean and well maintained. The location was fantastic ‚Äî just close to the city centre and surrounded by great restaurants and caf√©s. One of the highlights was the beautiful garden, which added a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere to our stay. The staff were incredibly kind and professional, providing excellent service throughout. Every detail was thoughtfully handled, making us feel truly welcome. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a memorable and relaxing experience.

## Amazing Stay at Narain Niwas Palace Hotel
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Narain Niwas and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warm hospitality and exceptional service.

## Highlights:
- *Comfortable Rooms*: The room was spacious, clean, and exquisitely decorated. The bed was comfortable, and the amenities were top-notch.
- *Exceptional Service*: The staff were friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure my needs were met.
- *Delicious Food*: The hotel's restaurant served mouth-watering dishes that exceeded my expectations.
- *Amenities*: The hotel's amenities, such as the fitness center and spa, were excellent.

## Overall Experience:
My stay at Narain Niwas was truly amazing. The hotel's attention to detail, combined with its excellent service and amenities, made it a memorable experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

## Rating: 5/5
Would definitely stay here again!

Visited Narain Niwas Palace was like stepping into a piece of Jaipur‚Äôs royal history. The property is full of charm‚Äîvintage furniture, colorful Rajasthani frescoes, and sprawling gardens that give it a peaceful, regal vibe. It doesn‚Äôt feel like a typical hotel, but more like a heritage home with a lot of character.

The rooms are spacious and thoughtfully done, maintaining the old-world charm while still being comfortable. The staff was courteous and made sure we had a pleasant stay. The location is great too‚Äîcentrally placed but tucked away from the city noise.

I also visited  the Shikarbagh restaurant on-site‚Äîperfect for a relaxed evening. Overall, it was a memorable and unique experience, especially if you enjoy heritage properties and a slower, more elegant pace of travel.

In terms of facilities it could also be an awesome
4 star hotel but it‚Äôs not. Service is terrible, every time I was there to ask anything they let me wait an because, despite the fact there were 3 people in the desk, everything pass through a single person. Don‚Äôt really know what others employee were doing. From a four star hotel in India, I did expect a money exchange services or at least an ATM on the premises and it doesn‚Äôt. The breakfast is ok but could be much better, look like everyone is cooked while in advance. The pool is really nice but I thing the sun lounger need to be moved on the other side where the grass is much more and the ground is flat. When you get out from the pool there is a part with no grass and your feet get dirty easily. In addition the ground is not leveled and really uncomfortable. The service at the swimming pool need to be improved. One single person for towels and drinks is not enough.
The rooms and bathroom were pretty big and had all the confort, not gonna lie. This hotel, with a decent management could be a really nice pearls since the calm and green who surrendered this place. Had an amazing massage a the spa, the guy is really good at.

Over rated, Over Priced compared to others that offer a lot more. For a premium hotel, they do not even have a Valet, park your car and walk please. The cutlery in room was used and un replaced, photo attached. The bathroom stank like a Mumbai naala (drain). Pretty ordinary experience. Had asked them to cook baby food (khichdi), again not edible

places.description: Elegant rooms in a posh hotel dating from 1928, plus an upscale restaurant, a spa & an outdoor pool.
places.address: Hotel Narain Niwas Palace Kanota Bagh, Narayan Singh Rd, Rambagh, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302004, India

places.generalDescription: Amidst the chaos of the city of Jaipur, lies the splendid Jal Mahal, or Water Palace. Floating in the centre of the Sagar Lake, this low rise symmetrical palace in Jaipur was once a shooting lodge for the Maharajas.
places.name: Jal Mahal

reviews.text: It's A great place to view click pictures with your friends and family. Spending a good time here. Buy something for home decoration eat street food. Camel üê™ ride most important here. Historic place has great vibes here.

As entry isn't allowed, so no tickets. Just spend the time by walking and just seating, chilling and enjoying the beautiful view. A palace in Lake and perk is it's green mount background. Away from high rise building, only you and nature.
Management should work over cleanliness here.

Great spot for photography and a beautiful view. Maintenance could be better, and boating should start again to enhance the experience. Nearby you‚Äôll find food stalls, cultural products, and options to click pictures in traditional Rajasthani attire

Jal Mahal, Jaipur is a beautiful architectural gem located in the middle of the lake, but currently, entry into the palace is not allowed. Visitors can only enjoy its scenic beauty from the shore. The best time to visit is early morning‚Äîperfect for a peaceful walk, fresh air, and a pleasant view. The calm lake, cool breeze, and feeding the fishes add to the experience. A great spot to sit, relax, and enjoy the surroundings. Ideal for individuals, couples, and families. A must-visit photo stop while exploring Jaipur.

Jal Mahal is a pretty spot to visit in Jaipur. The view of the palace in the middle of the lake is amazing, especially in the evening. It does get a bit crowded since both tourists and locals enjoy hanging out here, and honestly, the place could be kept a little cleaner. But overall, it‚Äôs a nice stop to enjoy the scenery and click some great pictures.

places.description: In the middle of Man Sagar Lake sits this grand palace made of red sandstone, most of it submerged.
places.address: Jal Mahal, Amer, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002, India

places.generalDescription: The Hawa Mahal stands at the intersection of the main road in Jaipur, Badi Chaupad. It is regarded as the signature palaces of Jaipur and was built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh.
places.name: Hawa Mahal

reviews.text: The experience of being inside the palace was equally enriching. Navigating the winding ramps and staircases, I was able to appreciate the intricate details of the architecture up close. The views of the city from the upper floors are breathtaking, offering a panoramic perspective of Jaipur's vibrant streets and surrounding hills. It's a place that perfectly blends historical significance with stunning beauty. Whether you're a history buff, an architecture enthusiast, or simply looking for a glimpse into India's rich heritage, the Hawa Mahal is an absolute must-visit. It's an unforgettable experience that truly embodies the spirit of Jaipur.

If something in you remembers old stories, quiet dreams, or the simple joy of standing somewhere that has seen centuries pass‚ÄîHawa Mahal is made for you. It‚Äôs not just a monument; it‚Äôs a breath, a glimpse into royal lives, and a haven of artistry.
I‚Äôd recommend going early‚Äîbeat the heat, catch the gentle light, and let yourself be still for a moment. Let the wind, the pink walls, and the stairs carry you a little away from today and into something tender and timeless.

A must-visit landmark in Jaipur! Hawa Mahal is an architectural gem with stunning fa√ßade and intricate lattice windows that truly live up to its name The Palace of Winds. The view from the top gives a beautiful glimpse of the old city.

However, the inside is not as grand as the exterior, and there's not much information displayed about its history - so it helps if you go with a guide or read up a bit beforehand.

Great for photography, especially during sunrise or sunset. Night view is also beautiful with the lights on.

We Visited Hawa Mahal last Saturday ‚Äî and it truly lives up to its name, the Palace of Winds! üå¨Ô∏èüè∞
The iconic pink sandstone facade with 953 small windows (jharokhas) is not just stunning to look at but also tells stories of royal life and clever architecture. Climbing to the top gives a beautiful panoramic view of Jaipur‚Äôs old city, and the cool breeze flowing through the windows is refreshing even in the heat!

Ticket Charges - 52‚Çπ / Person
Guide Charges - 400‚Çπ

A must-visit for history lovers, architecture fans, and anyone who wants to experience the soul of Jaipur. üå∏üì∏

Hawa Mahal, or the ‚ÄúPalace of Winds,‚Äù is one of the most iconic landmarks in Jaipur. Built in 1799, this beautiful five-story palace made of red and pink sandstone is known for its 953 small windows, called jharokhas, designed to let cool air flow through the building.

The front of Hawa Mahal looks like a honeycomb or crown and is especially beautiful in the early morning light. Many people love taking photos from across the street, where several rooftop caf√©s offer the best views. From there, you can capture the full front of the palace‚Äîbut please note, most caf√©s only allow photography if you buy something, like a cup of coffee or a snack. It‚Äôs a small price for a great experience and view.

Hawa Mahal was originally built so royal women could watch street life and festivals without being seen. Today, you can go inside and walk up the narrow ramps to enjoy beautiful views of the old city and nearby landmarks like Jantar Mantar.

Inside the palace, there are breezy passages, quiet courtyards, and a small museum. It doesn‚Äôt take much time to visit, but it‚Äôs full of charm and history.

Please also remember not to write or scratch on the walls. It‚Äôs a historic site, and we should help protect its beauty.

Hawa Mahal is a must-see in Jaipur‚Äîperfect for photography, culture, and a quick coffee with a royal view.

places.description: Palace built in the form of a high wall to screen royal ladies as they watched street festivities.
places.address: Hawa Mahal Rd, Badi Choupad, J.D.A. Market, Kanwar Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002, India

places.generalDescription: Originally built as a vantage point nearly 300 years ago, Shahpura Haveli was later converted into a magnificent fortress. This is another one of the palaces in Jaipur which has now been converted into a heritage home.
places.name: Shahpura Haveli

reviews.text: We came to have lunch and we had a great time. The place is beautiful, and both the service and the food were excellent! We highly recommend to come :)

We recently visited Shahpura Haveli for a birthday celebration,and the entire experience was truly remarkable. The haveli itself is a stunning blend of heritage and elegance, but what truly sets it apart is the commendable hospitality and cooperation of the entire team.

A special thanks to Manager Satveer, who, along with his dedicated team, handled every shoot setup with absolute grace and professionalism. Their efforts made the entire process seamless and stress-free.

To make our celebration even more special, the team arranged a beautiful candlelight dinner, which added a magical touch to the evening. The culinary experience was outstanding ‚Äî the food prepared by Chef Abdul and team was full of flavor and authenticity, warmly served by Hamendra with utmost care. A big appreciation also goes to Rahul, who diligently assisted with food service and ensured that everything was perfect throughout.

Adding to this already memorable experience, Satveer and his team also arranged a farm visit near the haveli, where we had a wonderful time enjoying horse riding, feeding them, and connecting with the serene countryside vibes. It was an absolute delight and made our stay even more unique.

Overall, Shahpura Haveli gave us not just a celebration but a collection of unforgettable memories ‚Äî from heritage charm to thoughtful arrangements and heartfelt hospitality. We highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a truly remarkable experience.

I had booked this property for two nights, expecting a luxurious and elegant vacation with my family. We were hoping for a royal experience, but that expectation quickly faded when we visited the dining area for breakfast. Anticipating a grand buffet, we were disappointed to learn from the staff that due to low occupancy, the buffet was not available. The only breakfast options offered were poha and puri bhaji, but since puri bhaji would take time to prepare, poha was recommended.
This unexpected situation led to frustration within my family, who began blaming me for poor planning and not choosing a more reputable option like Hyatt or ITC instead of Shahpura Haveli. Our booking dates are August 4 and 5, 2025. With one night already spent, we are now considering canceling the remaining stay to opt for a better alternative.

I‚Äôm currently on vacation in India. As someone living in the U.S., I was excited to introduce my daughter to Indian traditions and culture. We chose Shahpura Haveli, believing it would be an ideal place to experience the essence of Rajasthan. Unfortunately, our experience was far from what was promised on their website.
There was no welcome upon our arrival, and the staff seemed disinterested and unmotivated throughout our stay. What was especially disheartening was witnessing a stark difference in how guests were treated‚Äîwhile we received no greeting, a group of foreign tourists who arrived the next day were given a grand, royal welcome.
It was incredibly disappointing to feel overlooked and discriminated against in our own country. Despite their claims of being a five-star property, the service and overall experience didn‚Äôt even meet the standards of a three-star hotel. There are several shortcomings at the property, but what hurt the most was the biased treatment‚Äîespecially when we had paid the same amount as the other guests.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Shahpura Haveli. The overall experience was excellent. The property is well-maintained, and the staff is genuinely hospitable. Satveer was exceptionally kind and attentive to all our needs. The farm experience, from the high tea to the horse ride for the kids, was truly memorable. Abdul ensured the horse riding was both safe and enjoyable. Shahpura Haveli is an outstanding property, and we highly recommend it!‚Äù

places.description: Genteel rooms, some with frescoes, in an elegant heritage hotel offering restaurants & bars.
places.address: MOTI MAHAL CHAUPAR, SHAHPURA, Shahpura, Rajasthan 303103, India

places.generalDescription: Located in Jaipur, The City Palace is the main palace from where the Maharaja reigned from. This palace in Jaipur includes the Chandra Mahan and Mubarak Mahal along with various other buildings within the complex.
places.name: The City Palace

reviews.text: The City Palace is one of the highlights of Jaipur. The architecture is breathtaking, with intricate designs, colorful courtyards, and royal halls that showcase the grandeur of Rajasthan. The museum inside offers a glimpse into the royal lifestyle with costumes, weapons, and artifacts. The place is well-maintained and gives you plenty of opportunities for photography. Definitely worth visiting if you‚Äôre exploring the Pink City!

The palace of the highness and really good to know that we have a king and prince.
They are really good people promoting state of art and culture to the people.
The palace is really beautiful and clean.
It attracts foreigners and many tourists who come to our country and see our customs and traditions and learn about our country.
Thank you for preserving such a beautiful heritage and traditions.
Very memorable visit and informative also.

I had a wonderful experience at the City Palace‚Äîit was clean, well-maintained, and beautifully showcased the grandeur of the royal family. Although there were a few areas under construction, the overall ambiance was impressive.

However, one thing that bothered me was the ticket pricing. The charges are quite high, with separate fees for different sections and museums inside the palace, which can be frustrating. Considering it‚Äôs a historical site, it would be great if the ticket prices were kept more affordable so everyone can appreciate and learn from this heritage.

Historical and beautiful intricate patterned palace that showcases antique collections of Royal family of Jaipur. The descendents of then Maharaja of Jaipur resides in one separate palace inside this. There are different tour packages one can opt for. Also tourist guides are available who show around entire palace in an hour with emphasis on what each collections mean. It takes typically 1 hour to stroll around whole area. There is shop also inside having good collection of pashmina and light weight Maharani saris. Entry fee is discounted for students carrying ID card and children.

Ticket price for foreigners were abit expensive but it was a beautiful experience! The palace is maintained so well and so beautiful! Only thing is the guide we were assigned to wasn't as knowledgeable, wish we had someone else.

places.description: Opulent 18th-century palace of Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II, now a museum & royal residence.
places.address: Gangori Bazaar, J.D.A. Market, Kanwar Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002, India

places.generalDescription: Jaigarh Fort is a grand structure perched on the top of the 'Cheel ka Teela' hills in the Pink City of Jaipur. This magnificent edifice was commissioned by Sawai Jai Singh II in the year 1726 to protect Amer Fort.
places.name: Jaigarh Fort

reviews.text: Jaigarh Fort is a must-visit in Jaipur for its grand architecture, stunning views of the Aravalli hills, and rich history. The fort is well-preserved, and the world‚Äôs largest cannon on wheels is truly impressive. Walking along the massive walls feels like stepping back in time. A perfect spot for history lovers and photographers alike!

of warfare.

Explore The Museum

The opulent monument houses a museum curled up at the left of Awami Darwaza, which allows you to get insights into the lives of the Royal families and warriors. The museum exhibits pictures of the Royal family, stamps, hand-drawn designs of the palace made by the architects of that time, and many other artifacts.

Ancient Temples

Explore some of the ancient temples at the fort, the Ram Harihar Temple of the 10th century and the Kal Bhairav Temple of the 12th century.

Other Tourist Attractions

Some of the other noteworthy architectures are Diwan-i-Aam, Shubhat Niwas, and the Diya Burj, which is the highest point of the fort.

I visited Jaigarh Fort recently and really enjoyed it. The fort is huge and gives a great view of the surrounding area. One of the main attractions is the world‚Äôs biggest cannon on wheels, called "Jaivana Cannon." It‚Äôs really amazing to see such a massive cannon from so many years ago. The fort feels strong and simple compared to some other forts, but it has its own charm. If you like history and great views, Jaigarh Fort is definitely worth a visit.

I recently visited Jaigarh Fort in Jaipur, and it was a wonderful experience. Perched on the Aravalli hills, the fort offers stunning panoramic views of Jaipur and the surrounding landscape. The massive walls, intricate architecture, and historical charm make it a delight for history lovers.

The highlight of the visit was seeing the Jaivana Cannon, the world‚Äôs largest wheeled cannon, which is a true masterpiece. The fort is well-preserved, with spacious courtyards, underground passages, and fascinating museums showcasing royal artifacts and weapons.

The peaceful atmosphere and the breathtaking views make it a perfect spot for photography and exploration. Jaigarh Fort is a must-visit for anyone interested in history, architecture, and stunning views.

Massive fort to visit. It is highly well maintained and also very neat and clean. It is the only fort in  Jaipur which is very beautiful, clean and maintained otherwise all other forts are very dirty. Car goes right on the top of the fort where the tea point is & without car it is very difficult to  reach there now a days.

places.description: Built to protect the Amber Fort complex below, this 3-km-long fort offers a museum & views.

places.generalDescription: Located about 8 kms from the city centre of Jaipur, Rambagh Palace is one among the finest palaces of Jaipur. Once a residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur, today the palace has been converted into a luxury heritage resort with brilliant architecture, lighting and facilities.
places.name: Rambagh Palace, Jaipur

reviews.text:
I recently stayed at your hotel and had a truly wonderful experience. Everything‚Äîfrom the warm hospitality to the cleanliness and comfort of the room‚Äîwas exceptional. The staff was incredibly courteous and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. The service was prompt and professional, and every small detail was taken care of perfectly. I also really appreciated the overall ambiance and peaceful environment of the hotel. It made my stay relaxing and enjoyable.

Thank you for such a great experience! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and look forward to staying here again in the future.

We recently stayed at Rambagh Palace in one of their Historical Suites, and it was an unforgettable experience. The entire property is breathtaking ‚Äì full of character, history, and charm. Every part of the palace feels special, and just walking around it is a treat for the eyes.

Our suite was elegant, spacious, and incredibly comfortable. The decor reflected the royal heritage of the palace while still offering all the modern comforts you‚Äôd expect. The bed was super cozy, and every little detail ‚Äì from the lighting to the bathroom essentials ‚Äì was well thought out. It felt luxurious and homely at the same time.

What made the stay even more memorable were the unique experiences ‚Äì vintage car rides, cultural performances, clay pot making, yoga, and even a horse carriage ride inside the palace grounds. These little touches added so much value to our trip and kept us engaged throughout.

One of the most charming things was the peacocks roaming freely around the property ‚Äì they‚Äôre friendly and beautiful, and you can even feed them!

Excellent Stay!
"I recently stayed at [Rambagh palace] and had a fantastic experience! The room was clean and comfortable, with modern amenities. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for exploring [Jaipur]. The hotel's facilities, including the [pool/restaurant/fitness center], were top-notch. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay in [Jaipur]. 5/5 stars!"

Wow! Nearly two hundred old buildings, he puts some of the modern architecture to shame. Such a beautiful my will and well maintained by the TAJ group.

The huge splendor lawns and greenery is the first thing you notice as you enter; Followed by this huge structure, something that makes the property unique.
The food is amazing. There restaurant "steam" It is out of this world and what an experience
Our stay at the Rambaugh Palace was truly exceptional. The property and its ambiance provided the perfect escape for our needs. The staff was incredibly humble and always eager to assist.

places.description: Grand hotel in a converted 19th-century palace with a spa, elegant dining & banquet facilities.
places.address: Bhawani Singh Rd, Rambagh, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302005, India
